metadata.title: CVE-2018-20511 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.18.11. The ipddp_ioctlfunction in drivers/net/appletalk/ipddp.c allows local users to obtainsensitive kernel address information by leveraging CAP_NET_ADMIN to readthe ipddp_route dev and next fields via an SIOCFINDIPDDPRT ioctl call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1034-aws - 4.4.0-1034.37
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1034.37').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
